programme.title: Spence vs. Peterson (R)
programme.desc: Undefeated welterweight world champion Errol Spence Jr. makes the first defense of his title against former two-division world champion Lamont Peterson. Live from Brooklyn's Barclays Center. REPLAY.(n)

programme.title: Sommore: A Queen With No Spades
programme.desc: Sommore is back for her 4th self-produced comedy special. Filmed at the Beautiful Faena Theater in Miami Beach, she covers topics ranging from her own personal growth and development, to her unique perspective on life, politics and individual choice.(n)

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Rap icon Eminem stars in this semi-autobiographical tale of a white kid struggling in the hip-hop scene of 1995 Detroit. Directed by Academy Award®-winner Curtis Hanson.(n)

programme.title: American Satan
programme.desc: Hellbent on following in the footsteps of their music idols, a young rock band moves to Los Angeles to chase their dreams of stardom on the Sunset Strip. When they meet an enigmatic stranger who seems to know them better than they know themselves, he preys on their most basic desires and emotions. He entices them with an offer that sets them on a path to fame and fortune. But when their debut album, AMERICAN SATAN, is released, it sets off a firestorm of controversy, death, and destruction beyond anything the music world could ever imagine.(n)

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars
programme.desc: This documentary contextualizes Eric Clapton’s role in contemporary music and cultural history. Told through his own words, it reflects on his traumatic childhood, his difficult struggle with drugs and alcohol, the loss of his son and how he always found his inner strength and healing in music. It features extensive interviews with Clapton himself, along with his family, friends, musical collaborators, contemporaries and heroes – including late music icons B.B. King, Jimi Hendrix and George Harrison. Directed by Oscar winner Lili Fini Zanuck.(n)

programme.title: Bipolar Rock 'N' Roller
programme.desc: A raw and unflinching account of Mauro Ranallo's decades-long struggle with Bipolar Affective Disorder. The voice of WWE and Showtime Championship Boxing, Ranallo has called some of the biggest sports events in history - all the while fighting his own epic battles with mental health. Follow his journey as he combats the stigma behind mental health issues and sheds light on what it's like being at the top of the industry despite seemingly insurmountable odds.(n)

programme.title: Patriots Day
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombing, Police Sergeant Tommy Saunders (Mark Wahlberg) joins courageous survivors, first responders and investigators in a race against the clock to hunt down the bombers before they strike again. The stories of Special Agent Richard Deslauriers (Kevin Bacon), Police Commissioner Ed Davis (John Goodman), Sergeant Jeffrey Pugliese (J.K. Simmons) and nurse Carol Saunders (Michelle Monaghan) are all woven together to show the strength of the city.(n)

programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker
programme.desc: Harrison Ford and Liam Neeson star in this gripping, fact-based action drama about the crew of a crippled Russian submarine - the communist country's first nuclear vessel, and one that's nearing a meltdown that could spark a worldwide conflagration at the height of the Cold War. Kathryn Bigelow ("Near Dark") directed this taut thriller costarring Peter Sarsgaard and Joss Ackland.(n)

programme.title: Equilibrium
programme.desc: Christian Bale stars in this gripping sci-fi action-drama about a futuristic law enforcer who's part of an elite squad hunting down "sense offenders" - those who refuse to take medication that renders them unable to feel emotions. Angus MacFadyen, Emily Watson, Taye Diggs and Sean Bean costar in this thoughtful, fast-paced blend of "The Matrix" and George Orwell's "1984.".(n)

programme.title: The Cured
programme.desc: After years of a zombie plague that ravaged Europe, humanity grapples with how to reintegrate the former zombies into society.(n)

programme.title: Patriots Day
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombing, Police Sergeant Tommy Saunders (Mark Wahlberg) joins courageous survivors, first responders and investigators in a race against the clock to hunt down the bombers before they strike again. The stories of Special Agent Richard Deslauriers (Kevin Bacon), Police Commissioner Ed Davis (John Goodman), Sergeant Jeffrey Pugliese (J.K. Simmons) and nurse Carol Saunders (Michelle Monaghan) are all woven together to show the strength of the city.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Fockers
programme.desc: Ben Stiller is back as Gaylord "Greg" Focker, the unlucky fiancé who must endure another humiliating parental exchange. Having given him their daughter's hand, Jack and Dina Byrnes (Oscar® winner Robert De Niro and Blythe Danner) now travel to Florida to meet Greg's parents - a couple who couldn't be more different from the ex-CIA agent and his wife. Oscar® winners Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand co-star as the eccentric Fockers.(n)

programme.title: Jasper Jones
programme.desc: Toni Collette, Hugo Weaving, Levi Miller, Angourie Rice, Dan Wyllie and Aaron McGrath star in the story of Charlie Bucktin, a bookish boy of 14 living in a small town in Western Australia. In the dead of night during the scorching summer of 1969, Charlie is startled when he is woken by local mixed-race outcast Jasper Jones outside his window. Jasper leads him deep into the forest and shows him something that will change his life forever, setting them both on a dangerous journey to solve a mystery that will consume the entire community.(n)

programme.title: Cairo Time
programme.desc: A diplomat's wife (Patricia Clarkson) stranded in Cairo, Egypt finds herself attracted to an old friend of her husband's who volunteers to guide her around the city during her stay. Alexander Siddig costars with Elena Anaya in this romantic culture clash drama.(n)

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Jess and Leslie couldn't be more different—she's rich, he's poor, she's from the city, he's from the country—but when Leslie begins to open up the world of imagination to Jess, they find they have something amazing to share: the kingdom of Terabithia, a realm of giants, ogres and other enchanted beings that can only be accessed by boldly swinging across a stream in the woods on a strand of rope. Here, Leslie and Jess rule as King and Queen among the incredible creatures they create, and not even the forces of evil can break their bond.(n)

programme.title: Mrs McCutcheon
programme.desc: Having always felt he was born in the wrong body, 10-year-old Tom chooses the name Mrs McCutcheon rather than the name he was given at birth; he also prefers the flow of a dress rather than the cut of a pant. Now at his third school, Tom is having trouble settling in and finding acceptance from his newfound peers - except for Trevor, a tough little charmer who also suffers prejudice due to his Aboriginal heritage.(n)

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.(n)

programme.title: Jurassic School
programme.desc: Nerdy middle schooler Tommy is forced take care of a baby dinosaur after his cloned science fair project hatches early. He quickly begins to think of the creature not only as a pet, but also as a friend. But when the dinosaur escapes on the day of the fair, Tommy must figure out a way to get the creature back before greedy grown-ups get to him first.(n)

programme.title: Swing Away
programme.desc: Following a meltdown that leads to a suspension, professional golfer Zoe Papadopoulos travels to her grandparents' village in Greece to escape the harsh spotlight of the international sports world. Between baking bread and eating baklava, she meets and mentors a ten-year-old girl who is determined to become the next golf sensation. Along the way, Zoe rediscovers her Greek heritage, her love of the game and the hidden strength within herself.(n)

programme.title: All Styles
programme.desc: Teen dance drama about a young hip hop artist who is rejected by his old dance crew for heading off to college before a major competition. As a result, he assembles a ragtag crew to face off against his former friends.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeats
programme.desc: A feisty American hip hop dancer travels to India with her family for a wedding and falls in love - both with a new style of dance, and with the determined young man who introduces it to her.(n)

programme.title: Snow Dogs
programme.desc: When a Miami dentist inherits a team of sled dogs, he's got to learn the trade or lose his pack to a crusty mountain man.(n)

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: A devoted dog (voiced by Josh Gad) finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he teaches to laugh and love. Also starring Dennis Quaid, Britt Robertson, K.J. Apa, Peggy Lipton and Pooch Hall.(n)

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: In the wake of Princess Diana's death, the very private and tradition-bound Queen Elizabeth II finds herself in conflict with the new Prime Minister, the slickly modern and image-conscious Tony Blair.(n)

programme.title: Marshall
programme.desc: In 1940, long before he sits on the US Supreme Court or claimed victory in Brown v. Board of Education, Thurgood Marshall (Chadwick Boseman) is a young rabble-rousing attorney for the NAACP. Marshall explores one his greatest challenges in those early days: the case of black chauffeur Joseph Spell (Sterling K. Brown), accused by his white employer, Eleanor Strubing (Kate Hudson), of sexual assault and attempted murder.(n)

programme.title: The Four Feathers
programme.desc: Heath Ledger stars in this rollicking 19th century adventure based on the classic novel about a conscientious objector whose opposition to England's war in the Middle East estranges him from his fiancee (Kate Hudson) and his best friend (Wes Bentley), until a tragic turn of events forces him to heroically rescue the latter from a remote Sudanese prison.(n)

programme.title: Drunkboat
programme.desc: A young teenager, Abe (Jacob Zachar), manipulates the unsuspecting help of his alcoholic Uncle Mort (John Malkovich) to buy a boat from a con man named Mr. Fletcher (John Goodman).(n)

programme.title: New Wave: Dare to be Different
programme.desc: In August, 1982, a small group of radio visionaries at WLIR Long Island knew they couldn't compete with the mega radio stations in New York City. With one brave decision, they changed the sound of radio forever. Program Director Denis McNamara, the crew at the station and the biggest artists of the era tell the story of how they battled the FCC, the record labels, mega-radio and all the conventional rules to create a musical movement that brought the New Wave to America - including bands like U2, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode and Blondie.(n)

programme.title: Becoming Cary Grant
programme.desc: Using words from his unpublished autobiography along with newly-discovered personal footage shot with a film-maker's eye, Cary Grant - one of Hollywood's greatest stars - tells his story himself. Exploring his long journey from childhood poverty to global fame, this radically new perspective of a man on a quest to find the love that eluded him most of his life reveals the man behind the mask of subtle charm and suave sophistication.(n)

programme.title: Tim & Faith: Soul2Soul
programme.desc: Includes live performances from Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's 2017 Soul2Soul world tour, as well as an intimate look inside their relationship. Never before seen interviews are presented along side behind-the-scenes footage, capturing their chemistry on and off the stage. Directed and executive produced by the award-winning team of Dan Cutforth and Jane Lipsitz.(n)

programme.title: Perfect in '76
programme.desc: SHOWTIME documentary revisiting the ‘76 Hoosiers and renowned coach Bobby Knight, who led his Indiana team to a perfect 32-0 season and a national championship.(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Seconds before Earth is destroyed to make way for a new hyperspace express route, mild-mannered Arthur Dent is whisked into space by his best friend (an alien posing as an out-of-work actor). And so the misadventures begin as he and fellow travelers, including the cool but dim-witted President of the Galaxy, the Earth girl Trillian, and Marvin the paranoid android, search for answers to the mystery of Life, the Universe and Everything.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
programme.desc: Super-spy siblings Carmen and Juni (Alexa Vega and Daryl Sabara) are back to rid the world of another villainous menace in this sci-fi action sequel from writer/director Robert Rodriguez ("El Mariachi"). This time, the Cortez kids - now official government agents - are assigned to find and stop the nefarious energy-sapping plans of Romero (Steve Buscemi), a mad scientist whose tropical island lair is populated with mutant experiments-gone-awry. Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino, Ricardo Montalban and Holland Taylor costar.(n)

programme.title: Bigfoot and the Burtons
programme.desc: When an ignored little boy bonds with Bigfoot and discovers the human-like ape is in danger, he finds the courage to stand up to those bigger than him to save the creature and set his new friend free.(n)

programme.title: The Beaver
programme.desc: When his toy company nears bankruptcy and his wife kicks him out of his house, CEO Walter Black (Mel Gibson) unsuccessfully attempts suicide. Hitting a psychological rock bottom, Walter adopts a discarded beaver hand puppet and begins communicating with the world through this alternate personality, an oddball tactic that allows him to slowly reconnect with his family and rebuild his broken spirit. Jodie Foster and Anton Yelchin costar in this quirky drama.(n)

programme.title: Breakin' 2: Electric Boogaloo
programme.desc: A break-dancing crew comes to the rescue of a community center facing demolition at the hands of a greedy real-estate developer.(n)

programme.title: The Haunted Mansion
programme.desc: A realtor and his wife and children are summoned to a mansion, which they soon discover is haunted, and while they attempt to escape, he learns an important lesson about the family he has neglected.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
programme.desc: Super-spy siblings Carmen and Juni (Alexa Vega and Daryl Sabara) are back to rid the world of another villainous menace in this sci-fi action sequel from writer/director Robert Rodriguez ("El Mariachi"). This time, the Cortez kids - now official government agents - are assigned to find and stop the nefarious energy-sapping plans of Romero (Steve Buscemi), a mad scientist whose tropical island lair is populated with mutant experiments-gone-awry. Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino, Ricardo Montalban and Holland Taylor costar.(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Seconds before Earth is destroyed to make way for a new hyperspace express route, mild-mannered Arthur Dent is whisked into space by his best friend (an alien posing as an out-of-work actor). And so the misadventures begin as he and fellow travelers, including the cool but dim-witted President of the Galaxy, the Earth girl Trillian, and Marvin the paranoid android, search for answers to the mystery of Life, the Universe and Everything.(n)

programme.title: Jasper Jones
programme.desc: Toni Collette, Hugo Weaving, Levi Miller, Angourie Rice, Dan Wyllie and Aaron McGrath star in the story of Charlie Bucktin, a bookish boy of 14 living in a small town in Western Australia. In the dead of night during the scorching summer of 1969, Charlie is startled when he is woken by local mixed-race outcast Jasper Jones outside his window. Jasper leads him deep into the forest and shows him something that will change his life forever, setting them both on a dangerous journey to solve a mystery that will consume the entire community.(n)

programme.title: School Ties
programme.desc: In the 1950's, a talented quarterback (Brendan Fraser) from a working class Jewish family earns a scholarship to a prestigious New England prep school, but must keep his religious faith a secret from his blue blood classmates. Matt Damon and Amy Locane costar in this period drama.(n)

programme.title: Fair Haven
programme.desc: A young piano prodigy returns to his family farm, after a long stay in a gay conversion therapy, and is torn between the expectations of his emotionally distant father and the memory of a past, loving relationship he's tried to bury.(n)

programme.title: Crowning Jules
programme.desc: Jules is a bright and sassy 17 year-old who desperately wants to leave her Midwestern family's alumni traditions behind, but to get to her once-in-a-lifetime Harvard admissions interview, she's forced to hitch a ride with her twin sister/nemesis, Madison, who is headed to a beauty pageant. Their road trip takes a turn when the teenage sisters unwittingly come into possession of a stolen jewel and are pursued by dangerous thieves.(n)

programme.title: All Styles
programme.desc: Teen dance drama about a young hip hop artist who is rejected by his old dance crew for heading off to college before a major competition. As a result, he assembles a ragtag crew to face off against his former friends.(n)

programme.title: Jurassic School
programme.desc: Nerdy middle schooler Tommy is forced take care of a baby dinosaur after his cloned science fair project hatches early. He quickly begins to think of the creature not only as a pet, but also as a friend. But when the dinosaur escapes on the day of the fair, Tommy must figure out a way to get the creature back before greedy grown-ups get to him first.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeats
programme.desc: A feisty American hip hop dancer travels to India with her family for a wedding and falls in love - both with a new style of dance, and with the determined young man who introduces it to her.(n)

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.(n)

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Matthew Broderick and Christopher Walken star in this satirical remake of the classic thriller about a planned community where the picture-perfect women are a little too eerily flawless. Glenn Close, Bette Midler, Jon Lovitz and Roger Bart costar in this wickedly acerbic comedy from writer Paul Rudnick ("Addams Family Values," "In & Out").(n)

programme.title: Hey Arnold! The Movie
programme.desc: Nickelodeon's popular hero with the football-shaped head gets his very own feature film with this animated family adventure that finds Arnold and his friends trying to stop a crooked developer from ruining their neighborhood, with the help of a superhero and a shadowy inside source. Featuring the voices of Paul Sorvino, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Christopher Lloyd.(n)

programme.title: New Wave: Dare to be Different
programme.desc: In August, 1982, a small group of radio visionaries at WLIR Long Island knew they couldn't compete with the mega radio stations in New York City. With one brave decision, they changed the sound of radio forever. Program Director Denis McNamara, the crew at the station and the biggest artists of the era tell the story of how they battled the FCC, the record labels, mega-radio and all the conventional rules to create a musical movement that brought the New Wave to America - including bands like U2, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode and Blondie.(n)

programme.title: 68 Kill
programme.desc: Trailer-dwelling, sewage-pumping Chip (Matthew Gray Gubler) has got one thing going for him: he's head over heels infatuated with his girlfriend Liza (AnnaLynne McCord). He's more than willing to overlook her wild streak—the fact that she's hooking up with their landlord; her rather extreme mood swings —so when she proposes a plot to steal $68,000, he goes along with the plan. But when what was supposed to be a simple heist turns into an off-the-rails, blood-spattered crime spree.(n)

programme.title: The Wings of the Dove
programme.desc: Kate is a beautiful young society woman whose desire for a common journalist presents her with an impossible decision: leave him, or marry - and face a life of poverty. However, she befriends a lonely young heiress whose own tragic secret offers an irresistible, but dangerous solution.(n)

programme.title: Band Aid
programme.desc: Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple who can't stop fighting. Advised by their therapist to try and work through their grief unconventionally, they are reminded of their shared love of music. In a last-ditch effort to save their marriage, they decide to turn all their fights into song, and with the help of their neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen), they start a band.(n)

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.(n)

programme.title: JIMI: All Is By My Side
programme.desc: André Benjamin stars as Jimi Hendrix in this revealing biopic from writer-director John Ridley ('12 Years A Slave'). Covering a transformative year in Hendrix's life from 1966-67, in which he went from a New York City backing musician to making his mark in London's music scene up until his Monterey Pop triumph, the film presents an intimate portrait of the sensitive young musician on the verge of becoming a rock legend.(n)

programme.title: Claire in Motion
programme.desc: Three weeks after Claire's husband mysteriously disappears, the police end their investigation. Claire doesn't give up, and soon discovers his troubling secrets, including a graduate student with whom he had formed a close bond. As she digs deeper, Claire begins to lose her grip on how well she truly knew her husband and questions her own identity in the process.(n)

programme.title: Alone in Berlin
programme.desc: Otto and Anna Quangel (Brendan Gleeson & Emma Thompson) are a working-class husband and wife doing their best to ride out the war in Berlin in 1940. When their son is killed fighting on the frontlines however, everything changes. They begin pouring their rage and grief into postcards emblazoned with anti-Nazi slogans, risking everything to get their messages of protest across the city. This seemingly small act of subversion rattles the regime, including a police inspector (Daniel Brühl) who will not rest until the culprits have been caught.(n)

programme.title: Primal Rage
programme.desc: Lost deep in the forest of the Pacific Northwest, Ashley and Max Carr are stalked by a terrifying creature that might be Bigfoot. Embroiled in a strange land of Native American myth and legend turned real, they must fight back against the monster in a desperate battle of life or death.(n)

programme.title: Last Seen in Idaho
programme.desc: A woman awakens from a coma after a car accident and begins having shocking visions of her future murder. It's a race against the clock as she tries to solve and prevent her own murder.(n)

programme.title: High Resolution
programme.desc: Two young New York writers fall in and out of love amidst a whirlwind of drugs, parties, technology, and travel. As one relationship collapses, another blooms for Erin, swept into the world of Paul Chen, a mysterious, charismatic author. When he proposes documenting every aspect of their new romance in an epic laptop-filmed "documentary", the couple enters into a performative bad romance, fueled by substances and sleepless nights.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.(n)

programme.title: The Beaver
programme.desc: When his toy company nears bankruptcy and his wife kicks him out of his house, CEO Walter Black (Mel Gibson) unsuccessfully attempts suicide. Hitting a psychological rock bottom, Walter adopts a discarded beaver hand puppet and begins communicating with the world through this alternate personality, an oddball tactic that allows him to slowly reconnect with his family and rebuild his broken spirit. Jodie Foster and Anton Yelchin costar in this quirky drama.(n)

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
programme.desc: Romantic comedy-drama about a pair of American friends (Scarlett Johansson and Rebecca Hall) who vacation together in Spain and fall under the romantic spell of Juan, a passionate artist (Javier Bardem).(n)

programme.title: Life During Wartime
programme.desc: One sister is a bitter screenwriter, another meets an older man she hopes will give structure to her disordered life, and a third must deal with a child-molesting ex-husband who has been paroled from jail and wants to reconcile with their son. Allison Janney, Ally Sheedy and Shirley Henderson star in this dysfunctional family drama from director Todd Solondz, a sequel to his earlier film "Happiness" that casts new actors in the same roles.(n)

programme.title: The Killer Inside Me
programme.desc: A deputy sheriff (Casey Affleck) in a small West Texas town of the 1950's tries with increasing desperation to hide his tortured, sadomasochistic affair with a prostitute (Jessica Alba), as well as the fact that he is a serial killer. Kate Hudson costars in this gritty, hard-boiled drama.(n)

programme.title: Brimstone
programme.desc: Liz (Dakota Fanning) is full of heart and grit but is being hunted by a vengeful Preacher (Guy Pearce) who is a diabolical zealot. She's a genuine survivor and uses her strength to claim the better life she and her daughter deserve.(n)

programme.title: I, Daniel Blake
programme.desc: Daniel Blake (Dave Johns) is a man out of time. He's a widowed woodworker who's never owned a computer and lives according to his own common sense moral code. After a heart attack leaves him unable to work and the state welfare system fails him, Daniel must stand up and fight for his dignity and lead a one-man crusade for compassion that transforms the lives of a single mother (Hayley Squires) and her two children.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Lover
programme.desc: Sara Gold is a young girl on a quest to save man's best friend. When she goes undercover to take down a dog breeder suspected of wrongdoing, she quickly finds out she might be on the wrong side of right. Sara must make a decision: to continue and follow the orders of her organization, United Animal Protection Agency, or trust her instincts and the boy she's fallen in love with.(n)

programme.title: Goodland
programme.desc: When a stranger arrives the same day a body is discovered outside of town, a local sheriff tries to piece together a string of events that don't quite add up.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeats
programme.desc: A feisty American hip hop dancer travels to India with her family for a wedding and falls in love - both with a new style of dance, and with the determined young man who introduces it to her.(n)

programme.title: Boomerang
programme.desc: New York marketing exec Marcus Graham is a wolf in chic clothing, a ladies' man dedicated to life, liberty and the happiness of pursuit. He soon learns that what goes around comes around when he meets a stylish woman who treats men the same way he treats women.(n)

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: When an unseen enemy threatens mankind by taking over their bodies and erasing their memories, Melanie (Saoirse Ronan) risks everything to protect the people she loves — her friends, her brother and her Uncle Jeb (William Hurt).(n)

programme.title: Prom Night
programme.desc: Donna's senior prom is supposed to be the best night of her life. After surviving a horrible tragedy, she has finally moved on and is enjoying her last year of high school. Surrounded by her best friends, she should be safe from the horrors of her past. But when the night turns deadly, there is only one person who could be responsible - a man she thought was gone forever. Now, Donna and her friends must find a way to escape the sadistic rampage of an obsessed killer, and survive a night "to die for.".(n)

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Matthew Broderick and Christopher Walken star in this satirical remake of the classic thriller about a planned community where the picture-perfect women are a little too eerily flawless. Glenn Close, Bette Midler, Jon Lovitz and Roger Bart costar in this wickedly acerbic comedy from writer Paul Rudnick ("Addams Family Values," "In & Out").(n)

programme.title: Employee of the Month (2006)
programme.desc: A slacker box boy (Dane Cook) at a New Mexico superstore tries to impress a gorgeous new coworker (Jessica Simpson) by transforming himself into a model corporate drone, but runs up against the previous 17-time holder (Dax Shepard) of the store's "employee of the month" honor.(n)

programme.title: Boomerang
programme.desc: New York marketing exec Marcus Graham is a wolf in chic clothing, a ladies' man dedicated to life, liberty and the happiness of pursuit. He soon learns that what goes around comes around when he meets a stylish woman who treats men the same way he treats women.(n)

programme.title: Prom Night
programme.desc: Donna's senior prom is supposed to be the best night of her life. After surviving a horrible tragedy, she has finally moved on and is enjoying her last year of high school. Surrounded by her best friends, she should be safe from the horrors of her past. But when the night turns deadly, there is only one person who could be responsible - a man she thought was gone forever. Now, Donna and her friends must find a way to escape the sadistic rampage of an obsessed killer, and survive a night "to die for.".(n)

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: After leaving a party together, coworkers David (Brian Geraghty), Emily (Alice Eve) and Corey (Josh Peck) stop at an ATM. Pulling into a desolate parking lot, Corey gets out to get cash and a routine transaction turns into a struggle for survival when an unknown man appears outside blocking their exit. With the wintry temperatures dipping below freezing, and the morning sunrise still hours away, they have no choice but to play the man's deadly game of cat-and-mouse.(n)

programme.title: Cairo Time
programme.desc: A diplomat's wife (Patricia Clarkson) stranded in Cairo, Egypt finds herself attracted to an old friend of her husband's who volunteers to guide her around the city during her stay. Alexander Siddig costars with Elena Anaya in this romantic culture clash drama.(n)

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Kepler's Dream
programme.desc: A young girl searches for a rare book that is missing from her grandmother's collection and tries to understand why her family is fractured.(n)

programme.title: Cursed to Kill
programme.desc: Rachel awakens in a hospital, paralyzed from the waist down after a failed attempt on her life for abandoning a cult suicide. Her suffering grows as the spirits of the deceased members begin to haunt her within the confines of the hospital room. They threaten to kill her unless she is willing to offer up a kindred soul in place of her own - her brother's child. But the week that Rachel is given to make her decision is tethered to a curse. All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.(n)

programme.title: Swing Away
programme.desc: Following a meltdown that leads to a suspension, professional golfer Zoe Papadopoulos travels to her grandparents' village in Greece to escape the harsh spotlight of the international sports world. Between baking bread and eating baklava, she meets and mentors a ten-year-old girl who is determined to become the next golf sensation. Along the way, Zoe rediscovers her Greek heritage, her love of the game and the hidden strength within herself.(n)

programme.title: Denial
programme.desc: Acclaimed writer and historian Deborah E. Lipstadt must battle for historical truth to prove the Holocaust actually occurred when David Irving, a renowned denier, sues her for libel.(n)

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.(n)

programme.title: 4/20 Massacre
programme.desc: During a weed-fueled weekend, five young women decide to celebrate a friend's birthday by taking a camping trip to a nearby national park. However, their fun is quickly snubbed out when they stumble upon an illegal marijuana operation hidden in the greenery and protected by a bloodthirsty maniac. Will they survive or will they perish in search of the ultimate high?(n)

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.(n)

programme.title: American Graffiti
programme.desc: Coming of age classic, directed by George Lucas, following four teenagers in the early 60s on their last summer night before college, as they explore drag racing, romance, drive ins and experience America's last age of innocence. Stars Harrison Ford, Richard Dreyfuss and Ron Howard.(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Frank Capra satire about a Thoreau-quoting, tuba-playing small-town poet who inherits $20 million and, disillusioned with wealth, decides to give it all away, prompting his lawyer to have him declared insane. Capra's direction won an Oscar for this Best Picture nominee, and nominations also went to titular star Gary Cooper and screenwriter Robert Riskin. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
programme.desc: A filmmaker and his niece meet with a producer to sell a story that comes alive. The story involves him falling out of an airplane and into a mountain-top mansion with a woman who's never seen a man before.(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor and the Bobby-Soxer
programme.desc: A judge decides that the best way to curb the excesses of a playboy art teacher is to force him to do what he does best--romance a willing young lady, who happens to be the judge's teenage sister and who comes with a hand's-off order. Sidney Sheldon's script won an Oscar for Best Original Screenplay. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Arsenic and Old Lace
programme.desc: Macabre comedy about a pair of sweet old ladies from Brooklyn who put lonely bachelors out of their misery with sips from their arsenic-laced elderberry wine---"acts of mercy" that their visiting nephew finds hard to swallow. The film is based on Joseph Kesselring's Broadway play, a long-running hit that contractually delayed release of the picture almost three years (cc).(n)

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Joan Fontaine won a Best Actress Oscar in Alfred Hitchcock's classic suspense tale of a shy, wealthy woman who is romanced by a charming ne'er-do-well (Cary Grant), whom she marries and then comes to suspect is going to kill her. To his dying day, Hitchcock insisted that he wanted to retain novelist Francis Iles' original ending, but that RKO executives intervened. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Bringing Up Baby
programme.desc: Screwball comedy about a dog with a taste for dinosaur bones, a housebroken leopard named Baby, a madcap heiress who sets her cap for an absent-minded paleontologist, and a wacky menagerie of secondary characters. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
programme.desc: Manhattan marrieds "trade city soot for sylvan charm" when they move to the Connecticut suburbs, where they experience an endless succession of construction nightmares and fiascoes and their new place turns into a money pit. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Topper
programme.desc: The ghosts of a recently deceased, freewheeling couple decide to do one good deed for the living in order to get into heaven. (cc).(n)

programme.title: North by Northwest
programme.desc: Monumental Hitchcock thriller about an advertising executive (Cary Grant), mistaken for a spy, pursuing---and being pursued by---foreign agents, from New York to the top of Mount Rushmore. A superior blend of suspense and humor highlighted by the classic crop-duster sequence. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: The Bandit, a charismatic bootlegger, takes a bet to ship a truck full of beer from Texas to Arkansas. While pulling off the stunt, he falls in love with a woman engaged to the son of a dyspeptic sheriff who takes it upon himself to stop Bandit. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Deliverance
programme.desc: Four city dwellers take on the white water of a river in the backwoods of Georgia to enjoy the beauty of nature before a dam project ruins it. But the group gets separated, and the river and its surroundings are much worse than expected. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: Raucous, crowd-pleasing comedy-drama about a star-crossed quarterback (Burt Reynolds) reduced to calling the shots for a team of convicts in a game against the guards. Eddie Albert. Filmed in Georgia by director Robert Aldrich. Former NFL players Ray Nitschke and Joe Kapp costar.(n)

programme.title: The Tall Target
programme.desc: A police detective uncovers a sinister plot to assassinate President Lincoln during a train ride, and must furiously work against time to prevent it. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hooper
programme.desc: Death-defying feats provide the action in this story of stunt performers, with Burt Reynolds, Jan-Michael Vincent and Sally Field. Brian Keith. Max: John Marley. Cully: James Best. Adam: Adam West. Tony: Alfie Wise. Directed by Hal Needham. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Station West
programme.desc: In this Western whodunit, an undercover Federal agent investigates murders at an outpost, leading to a gang of gold thieves that he must infiltrate in order to bring them to justice. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit II
programme.desc: The Bandit attempts to transport a pregnant elephant from Miami to Dallas with Sheriff Buford T. Justice hot on his tail.(n)

programme.title: Best Friends
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds and Goldie Hawn as a screenwriting team whose warm relationship is chilled by their marriage. Jessica Tandy, Barnard Hughes. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Wasp Woman
programme.desc: A rejuvenating beauty treatment made from insect enzymes has unexpected side effects for an aging and vain cosmetics executive, who demanded to be the test subject for the new product. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Fly
programme.desc: A scientist mutates into a grotesque fly creature after a teleportation experiment goes awry. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Susan Slept Here
programme.desc: A Hollywood screenwriter working on a script about juvenile delinquents takes in a female teenage troublemaker to help with his research, and has to deal with a fiancée who thinks that the relationship is more than platonic. The film's opening narration is provided by an Oscar statuette. This was actor-singer Dick Powell's final big-screen appearance. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Bad and the Beautiful
programme.desc: Tinseltown takes a pounding in this portrait of a classic Hollywood heel, a callous, cutthroat producer who seduces and schemes his way to the top. Oscars went to Charles Schnee (Screenplay) and Gloria Grahame (Supporting Actress), and Kirk Douglas, as the producer, was nominated for Best Actor. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Meet the People
programme.desc: A welder falls for Broadway star Julie Hampton and gets her excited about a stage show he has written about the working class. Things turn sour when Julie and the producers disrespectfully turn the show into a Broadway musical extravaganza. (cc).(n)

programme.title: It Happened Tomorrow
programme.desc: A reporter (Dick Powell) supernaturally receives tomorrow's newspaper, giving him hot scoops. Then he sees his own obituary! Linda Darnell, Jack Oakie, Edgar Kennedy. programme.title: Mike Judge Presents: Tales From the Tour Bus
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. James Brown was renowned for his infectious voice and unbelievable dance moves, earning a reputation as the hardest-working man in show business. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mike Judge Presents: Tales From the Tour Bus
programme.desc: Conclusion. At the height of his fame, James Brown reigned supreme as the king of funk, the first voice and innovator of a brand-new musical genre. Behind the scenes, he was a taskmaster, feuding with rivals as well as members of his own band. By the 1980s, the work ethic that propelled him to superstardom began to take its toll. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kong Skull Island

programme.title: Thoroughbreds

programme.title: Mike Judge Presents: Tales From the Tour Bus
programme.desc: One of the biggest characters in funk history, Morris Day was an aspiring drummer who became the embodiment of cool. The iconic front man might have had a different life altogether, if not for childhood friend Prince Rogers Nelson, but he made a Faustian bargain with the future superstar, and the result was Morris Day and The Time. Though the band skyrocketed to the top with hits like "Jungle Love," resentment festered and the rivalry between the two singers reached a breaking point. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mike Judge Presents: Tales From the Tour Bus
programme.desc: Season 2 finale. The queen of funk, Betty Davis should have been a superstar. programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The presenter travels up the Rhine, creating her very own Christmas in her cabin aboard the SS Antoinette. Along the way, she visits some of the most dazzling festive markets that Europe has to offer, sampling traditional food and drink, as well as unique seasonal customs. Back on board, the fun continues as Jane joins her fellow shipmates to make decorations and create her signature Christmas dish. A rousing musical performance by carol singers entertains passengers as the ship makes its way to Switzerland, which is the final stop on this magical festive cruise.(n)
